article_title: Costa Concordia Days Away From Final Journey
article_text:
MILAN—More than two years after it ran aground off the Tuscan island of Giglio, the Costa Concordia is just a few days away from finally being towed to shore, where it will be dismantled and scrapped.

If the weather cooperates, the massive ship, which is more than three football fields long and has 13 decks, will on Monday or Tuesday begin its four-day journey to Genoa on Italy's northwest coast. More than 350 engineers, divers and other specialists are working to stabilize and move the Concordia, an operation that has so...

article_summary:
More than 350 engineers, divers and other specialists are working to stabilize and move the Concordia, an operation that has so...
MILAN—More than two years after it ran aground off the Tuscan island of Giglio, the Costa Concordia is just a few days away from finally being towed to shore, where it will be dismantled and scrapped.
If the weather cooperates, the massive ship, which is more than three football fields long and has 13 decks, will on Monday or Tuesday begin its four-day journey to Genoa on Italy's northwest coast.
